body:
I'm getting the same thing trying to install `diesel`

**Versions**
- **Rust:** 1.68.0 (2c8cc3432 2023-03-06)
- **Diesel:** 2.0.3
- **Database:** MySQL
- **Operating System:** Windows 11

Looks to be caused by a Quote update https://github.com/dtolnay/quote

issue.title: Recent update has a breaking change
issue.body: It appears a recent patch update has made breaking changes, causing `diesel` errors https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/issues/3541

body:
```
cargo update -p quote --precise 1.0.23
```

This works in the meantime, in case people are currently blocked.

I tried forking the repo and changing the version in `diesel_derives` and `migrations_macros` to `1.0.23` with no luck. I still get the error while installing the CLI. These crates are the only two with a direct dependency on the `quote` crate. `diesel_derives` actually uses version `1.0.9` so why is it even being affected?

<https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/blob/25afffb6f0d1537a496ffbc1842102aba7936dce/diesel_derives/Cargo.toml#L15> <https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/blob/25afffb6f0d1537a496ffbc1842102aba7936dce/diesel_migrations/migrations_macros/Cargo.toml#L11>

### Versions

- **Rust**: 1.67.0 (fc594f156 2023-01-24) (overridden by `rust-toolchain`)
- **Diesel**: `master` branch
- **Database**: N/A
- **Operating System**: Fedora Silverblue (inside and outside Toolbox container)

Hey it's HonbraDev! I believe it's because by default cargo allows and installs the latest patch version (^X.X.X) as it's not supposed to be breaking, there's a way to set explicit versions (`=X.X.X`)  

It's not recommended to explicitly mark dependencies because other projects depending on diesel will also be forced to use the same version if I remember correctly.

Oh hey, you replied while I was editing my reply.

I was making a temporary solution for myself because I'm currently high on caffeine (it's currently 1 AM) and desperately want to build something.  Here's the edit I was just about to post:

> I don't know how, I don't know why, but the above sommand somehow fixed it when I ran it in the repo root. Someone please tell me I'm not crazy.

> ```
> cargo update -p quote --precise 1.0.23
> ```
> 
> This works in the meantime, in case people are currently blocked.

For me it still fails. It seems still using the version 1.0.25 of quote  :
note: required by a bound in `quote::spanned::Spanned`
   --> /home/randrade/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/quote-1.0.25/src/spanned.rs:6:20


Sorry, I am new to rust. Is there some way to force it to use the quote 1.0.23 instead ?

> > ```
> > cargo update -p quote --precise 1.0.23
> > ```
> > 
> > 
> >     
> >       
> >     
> > 
> >       
> >     
> > 
> >     
> >   
> > This works in the meantime, in case people are currently blocked.
> 
> For me it still fails. It seems still using the version 1.0.25 of quote : note: required by a bound in `quote::spanned::Spanned` --> /home/randrade/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/quote-1.0.25/src/spanned.rs:6:20
> 
> Sorry, I am new to rust. Is there some way to force it to use the quote 1.0.23 instead ?

There is a way, but it's less good.  You can point to the commit that matches the version tag like this in your root Cargo.toml.

```toml
[patch.crates-io]
quote = { git = 'https://github.com/dtolnay/quote', rev="550af67" }
```

If there was a branch that represented the version, we could have pointed at that instead.
I see that in `diesel_derives` deps it has `quote = "1.0.9"` still. Don't know how could this happen. Set `quote` to `1.0.23` is working for me though but this seems just a temporary fix, isn't it?

This is happening due to a breaking change in quote. It seems like diesel accidentally depends on an API they consider as not public. See https://github.com/dtolnay/quote/issues/241 for details.
I will try to publish a patch release fixing this issues soon.
In the mean time you can use the following workarounds:

For installing diesel_cli: `cargo install diesel_cli --locked`
For projects depending on diesel add the following line to your `Cargo.toml`: `quote = "=1.0.23"`.

`cargo install diesel_cli --locked` worked for me (installing the CLI)

where `cargo update -p quote --precise 1.0.23` failed
Please do not post other error messages to this issue. We are aware of the quote problem and working on a fix. Posting here that it is still broken does not help fixing the issue.

I've published diesel_derives 2.0.2 to fix this issue. If you depend on diesel and hit this issue please run `cargo update -p diesel_derives ` to update your `diesel_derives` version. If you want to install `diesel_cli` that should just work now.

issue.title: `diesel_derives` fails to compile with recent version of `quote`

repository.name: diesel
repository.description: A safe, extensible ORM and Query Builder for Rust

issue.body:
## Problem Description

With a recent (breaking) change in quote, `diesel_derives` fails to compile. I also reported this issue against quote: https://github.com/dtolnay/quote/issues/245

### Error Message

```
   Compiling diesel_derives v2.0.1
error[E0277]: the trait bound `FieldAttr: ToTokens` is not satisfied
   --> /home/runner/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/diesel_derives-2.0.1/src/attrs.rs:143:6
    |
143 | impl Spanned for FieldAttr {
    |      ^^^^^^^ the trait `ToTokens` is not implemented for `FieldAttr`
    |
    = help: the following other types implement trait `ToTokens`:
              &'a T
              &'a mut T
              Abi
              Abstract
              AndAnd
              AndEq
              AngleBracketedGenericArguments
              Arm
            and 313 others
    = note: required because of the requirements on the impl of `quote::spanned::private::Sealed` for `FieldAttr`
note: required by a bound in `quote::spanned::Spanned`
   --> /home/runner/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/quote-1.0.25/src/spanned.rs:6:20
    |
6   | pub trait Spanned: private::Sealed {
    |                    ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ required by this bound in `quote::spanned::Spanned`

error[E0277]: the trait bound `StructAttr: ToTokens` is not satisfied
   --> /home/runner/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/diesel_derives-2.0.1/src/attrs.rs:242:6
    |
242 | impl Spanned for StructAttr {
    |      ^^^^^^^ the trait `ToTokens` is not implemented for `StructAttr`
    |
    = help: the following other types implement trait `ToTokens`:
              &'a T
              &'a mut T
              Abi
              Abstract
              AndAnd
              AndEq
              AngleBracketedGenericArguments
              Arm
            and 313 others
    = note: required because of the requirements on the impl of `quote::spanned::private::Sealed` for `StructAttr`
note: required by a bound in `quote::spanned::Spanned`
   --> /home/runner/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/quote-1.0.25/src/spanned.rs:6:20
    |
6   | pub trait Spanned: private::Sealed {
    |                    ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ required by this bound in `quote::spanned::Spanned`

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0277`.
error: could not compile `diesel_derives` due to 2 previous errors
```

## Setup

### Versions

- **Rust:** `rustc 1.63.0 (4b91a6ea7 2022-08-08)`
- **Diesel:** `diesel_derives v2.0.1`
- **Operating System:** Linux

body: Thanks a lot for the quick turnaround @weiznich, it's very much appreciated.

issue.title: Bump `diesel_derives` to `2.0.2`

repository.name: parsec-cloud
repository.description: Open source Dropbox-like file sharing with full client encryption !

issue.body: This will prevent the error tracked in diesel-rs/diesel#3541
